item.title: [GROOVY-389] cant use closures inside case statement
item.description:
I seem to be unable to use a closure inside a case statement. For example:

def testme(cmd, a) {
switch(cmd) {
case "list":
a.each

{ println it }

break
}
}

item.summary: cant use closures inside case statement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The problem was that the CodeVisitorSupport forgot to visit the code block in visiting the case statement.

public void visitCaseStatement(CaseStatement statement)

{ statement.getExpression().visit(this); statement.getCode().visit(this); // <== was missing }

Adding one line as in the above solved the problem.

A comma was missing in the last statement of the original test case. It should read:

testme "list", [1,2,3]
Thanks, Bing, for finding the problem. The fix is now in CVS.
